fields.description:
Dear support,

In one project, I have one hundred users in the same role. When I want to add a user in this role, Jira makes a warning. Is this a rule of Jira, or a bug?

I have a screenshot of this. Can you tell me to which email address can I send it ?

Thanks you.

Regards,
fields.summary: Maximum user in a role

fields.description: Allow customers the ability to export attachments with their original name, instead of a number, as currently there's no way to export attachments this way (as there are, currently, no add-on that satisfies this need). This would be useful for customers that want a .zip file containing all files and their original name, for archive purposes.
fields.summary: Export Attachments with their original name

fields.description: It would be extremely nice to have a notifications panel or something, so that I could see notifications (for example for status change of issues I am watching or for comments on issues I am engaged in) inside the web app. Right now, I have to open my email client and search for Jira emails (and also filter the ones that are actually related) alongside Jira itself to be able to tend to issues I need to tend to.
fields.summary: In-App Notification System

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some HTML code is visible when hovering the mouse pointer over the _Development_ icons in Kanban board cards.

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud, confirmed on Chrome, Safari, Firefox and Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Software project with Kanban board
# Add the field _Development_ to the Kanban card layout
# Hover the mouse pointer over the icons added by the _Development_ field
# Notice the HTML code visible

h3. Expected Results
When hovering the mouse pointer over the icons, information about development should be shown

h3. Actual Results
In Chrome and Safari, only HTML code is shown
In Firefox and Edge, the expected information is shown, but the HTML code is overlayed
fields.summary: html code visible in Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Incorrect number of issues showing in a software board when using iOS App


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a software board
# Create some issues and quick filters
# Select the newly created quick filter. (You may need to do this a couple of times till you notice that the number start showing incorrectly)

h3. Screenshots

In the web, selecting tes filter, you'll see 2 issues in the progress status and 1 issue in the to do list

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

but in the mobile app, it's showing 0:

 !mobile.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The right number of issues is showing

h3. Actual Results
See screenshot


h3.Workaround
Re-run the app or refresh the page by going to the project again
fields.summary: Quick filter is not showing the right number of issues in a software board in iOS App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Developer Panel, once you list the commits in Bitbucket, there is a hyperlink to the commit itself to the Bitbucket. However, when repository name is changed, the hyperlink does not get updated and is still pointing to the old repo.

h3. Environment
* For Bitbucket commits only, using DVCS Connector in Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Bitbucket Account to Jira Cloud through DVCS Connector
# In repository "Test", create some commits referencing to a Jira ticket (e.g. ABC-1)
# In ABC-1's Development Panel, each individual commit will be listed, and has a link such as:
#* https://bitbucket.org/<your_bitbucket_account>/Test/commits/<commit_id>
# In Bitbucket, edit "Test" repository and rename it to "Trial" repository
# Check ABC-1's Development Panel again

h3. Expected Results
In ABC-1's Development Panel, each individual commit will be listed, and has a new link such as:
#* https://bitbucket.org/<your_bitbucket_account>/Trial/commits/<commit_id>

h3. Actual Results
In ABC-1's Development Panel, each individual commit is still listed, and still pointing to old link such as:
#* https://bitbucket.org/<your_bitbucket_account>/Test/commits/<commit_id>
 
h3. Notes
* Tried disconnecting and re-creating the Bitbucket Account through DVCS Connector again, doesn't work
* Refereshing repositories list through DVCS connector doesn't work

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Link to a commit in Developer Panel is not updated when repository name is changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the new features available on Agility project, we are unable to change the issue type.
The option to change the issue type is not available.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agility Project
# On Settings, enable more issue types
# On Settings activate the new features (Backlog and Sprints)
# Go back to the board and create an issue and try to change the issue type
# The option to change the issue type is not available, even in the issue view.

Check the following video to understand better the bug
https://cl.ly/1x3N3s3r201q

h3. Expected Results

The option to change issue type should be working like when not using the new features

h3. Actual Results
The option to change the issue view is not clickable

h3.Solution / Workaround
The workaround is to disable the new features.
fields.summary: Unable to change issue type when using new features (backlog and sprints) on Agility board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Agility boards this error is being displayed: _"Board data failed to load - Try refreshing the page, or contact your admin"._
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

If you look in the browser console, it has an error 500.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud
* Agility boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce


h3. Expected Results
It should show the board and the backlog

h3. Actual Results
* It shows the death-skull of the error 500 when accessing the backlog
* It shows this pop up with error in the board view
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] so they can apply the fix.
fields.summary: "Board data failed to load" error message in Agility boards

fields.description:
As per requested by the customer, Russian translation to the word "issue" needs to be fixed.

- Word "issues" in the left menu translated as "проблемы".
- Word "issues" in the header translated as "задачи".

Could you please translate word "issues" in the left menu to "задачи"?

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Incorrect Russian translation for word "issue"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User creates the OAuth on Github but the Jira URL used on the token creation is not the same as the Jira where integration is being done.

h3. Suggested Solution
Throw an error informing the URLs don't match

h3. Why this is important
When the integration is done with the wrong URL customer is redirected to the URL of the instance set on OAuth 

h3. Workaround 
Edit the OAuth on Github and set the correct URL
fields.summary: Warn the user while creating the integration of Github if the OAuth is created with the wrong Jira URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Kanban boards will show *Done* issues if their *Fix Version* field includes an archived version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Kanban project with project key *KAN*
# Create a story, *KAN-1.*
# Create a version called *test-version*.
# Edit *KAN-1* and set its *Fix Version* field to *test-version*.
# Archive the version *test-version*.
# Move the story to the *Done* column in the board.
# Click *Release* and fill the field *Version name* with the value *1.0*.

h3. Expected Results
The issue *KAN-1* is no longer shown in the board.

h3. Actual Results
Issue *KAN-1* will be displayed on the board under the *Done* column.

h3.Workaround
# Review the issues still being displayed in the *Done* column and take note of their values of *Fix Version*.
# Navigate to the board's *Releases* page and filter by *Archived*.
# For every archived version retrieved from step 1, do the following:
## Unarchive the version.
## Release the version.
## Archive the version back.
fields.summary: Issues are not cleared from the Done column in a Kanban board after releasing the version due to belonging to archived versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating a new branch in BitBucket, Jira does not gets informed on who created the new branch.

h3. Suggested Solution
BitBucket should send who created the branch to Jira.

h3. Why this is important
This is required so that Post Functions can use this information on transitions (example: BitBucket sends the information of who created the branch and Jira uses this info to set the assignee of the issue in the same transition).

h3. Workaround 
There is none.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud to collect more information from BitBucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Following dead link in [Organize work with boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-software/organize-work-with-boards-937185155.html/] page results in "503 Service Unavailable" error:
- https://ix.atlassian.com/jira/getstarted/?_ga=2.268813625.990966968.1526261644-527282919.1506594899#!guides/set-up-jira-software/common-jira-software-setups

 !Organize work with boards.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Please update the link in the above page.
fields.summary: Update "Organize work with boards" documentation

fields.description: As per mentioned by our customer, assignee filter on the board for non-admin user would be very helpful. This feature would be very useful.
fields.summary: Allow non-admin users to have assignee filter on the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
By default, creating an issue in Backlog will reflect the board's JQL. But, when there are 2 or more boards in the same project, with different JQL filter. Switching from the 1st to 2nd board, and the issue created in the 2nd board will follow the 1st board's filter, and appear only in the 1st board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 or more boards in the project.
# Set the JQL filter for *board A* such as: {{project = A and labels = A}}
# Set the JQL filter for *board B* differently, such as: {{project = A and issuetype = B and labels = B}}
# Create an issue in *board A* in the backlog view.
# Then, switch to *board B*, and create an issue in the backlog view.
# The issue created in *board B* is labeled as *A* and is showing up only in *board A* instead of *board B*.

h3. Expected Results
* The issue should be created in *board B* with issuetype B and label B.

h3. Actual Results
* The issue is created based on the JQL for *board A*.

h3. Workaround
* After switching the board, refresh/reload the page first, then only create the issue.
fields.summary: Inline create issue in backlog after switching board in the same project does not work properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Workflow triggers with Pull request stopped working.

h3. Environment
Jira Software with Bitbucket integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the Pull request trigger in the workflow in Jira
# Do the applicable action in Bitbucket to trigger it in Jira

h3. Expected Results
The trigger should be triggered

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Workflow triggers with Pull request stopped working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Right-click not working for the issue key (on _stories based_ swimlane board) when filtering the assignee without including the current user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a board where the swimlane is based on stories.
 !image.png|thumbnail!
 # Select a different user on the *Assignee* filter.
 !image1.png|thumbnail!
 # Try to right click the story issues key at the swimlane line.

Check [this video|https://cl.ly/2o3B0c3a2N2V] recorded while reproducing this behavior. 
h3. Expected Results

The right click options should appear as it happens when issues where you're the assignee.
 !image4.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

No option is displayed.
 !image2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Solution / Workaround

Either use quick filters to filter by user or always include your user on the *Assignee* filter.
fields.summary: Right-click options doesn't appear on a swimlane story issuekey.

fields.description:
Summary
The button "Linked Pages" in the Backlog doesn't show in ADG2.

Steps to Reproduce
Access the backlog of an Software project and the option to access "Linked Pages" will not appear.

Workaround
Change it to ADG3.
fields.summary: Linked Pages Don't Show in Backlog on ADG2

fields.description:
As a Jira user I should be able to manage a simple checklist for a task, so that I can organise my own work without the overkill of opening n sub-tasks and assigning them to myself or installing a Jira plugin.

In the old Jira issue view the markdown parser includes support for check marks (/) (x) and (-)  These gave an instant visual queue to the progress of a task of many steps without the bloat of managing sub-tasks.

These do not work in the new Issue navigator and are rendered as plain text (/) . There is no alternative documented in the new [markdown documentation|https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax#overview].

Please add this to the new markdown parser as it enables users to continue making use of an existing feature.

My use case is a task setting up new employees:

(/) Jira and Confluence accounts
(/) Support Desk access
(/) Bitbucket team invite
(/) Google Apps for Business
(/) Google mail group Developers, Office and Tech.Support
() Workstation "offline account"
(/) Paysol Toolbox
(/) appogee Leave2 account for HR
() Office Skype chat
(/) Invite to Slack group
() Physical access to office
(/) LDAP account
(/) Add Nexus role
(/) Jenkins dev permissions
(/) Read only access to DB
(/) Welcome email sent with passwords and instructions
fields.summary: Check marks in markdown

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it's not possible to pull out any stories that make up the scope change. There's no JQL query that we can run that could help to generate the data. 

h3. Suggested Solution
In Release burndown chart, it would be great if it also shows the issues that make up the scope change. At the moment, it only shows the number without any issues referenced to the number.
fields.summary: Allow to pull out data/stories that make up the scope change from the release burndown chart

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the burndown chart, the line can be obscured by the legend. As a scrum master, I would like the burndown legend to be moved off the chart so I can see the burndown (or should I just say "burn" - not so much "down") line no matter how poorly the team is doing.

Example:
 !Screen Shot 2017-04-04 at 9.44.50 AM.png|thumbnail! 

See attached a screen shot of three charts laid out side-by-side on a three-column dashboard. You can see how the legend is covering the red burndown line on two of the three charts.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Start a sprint with some issues assigned
# Log work/change scope in the sprint such that the line goes to the top right corner of the chart

h3. Expected Results

The line should not be obscured by the legend.

h3. Actual Results

The line is obscured as per the summary.

h3. Suggestions
 The legend could be an on-off toggle since most people who are looking know what they are looking at.
 The legend could display in that unused white space below.
 Legend could be a "tool tip" (not good for wallboards)

* Would love to see the left column on the main dashboard page (that copies the same list of dashboards in the pulldown) go away, to give more horizontal space on the dashboard page, and this could have an effect on whether the line is covered.
* Would love the option to hide non-working days (like there used to be, and is on the board page).
* Often used the old option to hide the guideline as well. (Less confusing for the higher-ups.)
fields.summary: Legend on the Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget covers red burndown line

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to print Velocity Report using the browser print function(Ctrl + P in most browsers), the labels are missing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Velocity Report in a board
# Ctrl + P or Print using the browser's print function
# After getting the pdf file, the labels are missing from the report.
#* !Velocity Report.png|thumbnail! 
#*  !Velocity Report Print (labels missing).PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The labels should be displayed as it is displayed on the report.

h3. Actual Results
* The labels are not included in the printed version of the report.

h3. Workaround
* Screenshot the report and print from the screenshot.
fields.summary: Printing Velocity Report will not include the labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* If you remove the issues from a sprint after its closure, the Velocity Chart won't display this sprint (unlike other charts that *will* show historical data, such as Sprint report, Burndown, etc)

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create more several sprints in order to populate the Velocity chart
# Remove all the issues from a sprint
# Check the Velocity chart

*Note*: see this video of the problem replication
 [^velocitybug.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
* Velocity should show historical data

h3. Actual Results
* Velocity is not showing the sprints at all (if the sprint is empty)

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Velocity Chart not working if sprints are empty (without issues)

fields.description:
Hello There,

is there meanwhile any possibility to copy the actual work log to the comment for the Service-Desk in Cloud-Server?

We saw some running add-ons for Server but not for the Cloud-Version.

Is there any chance to implement this feature? Looks like someone already implemented this feature.

Best

M.Ebeling
fields.summary: Copy Worklog to Comments

fields.description:
We have large teams with very many tasks and it would be a lot easier to manage (and navigate!) if we could open a Kanban board with all swimlanes already collapsed.

leaving a browser open all the time is not an option.
fields.summary: Kanban board Swimlanes Collapsed by default

fields.description:
macOS: 10.12.6 (16G1212)

Safari: 10.1.2 (12603.3.8)

 

The sidebar cannot be scrolled and thus it’s possible for the UI to not reveal items lower in the sidebar on displays with constrained sizes. This leads to the user not being able to find items mentioned in the documentation. In the attached screenshot I demonstrate having to find the webhook admin link by searching through the DOM.

 

On Chrome there is a scrollbar visible on hover and scrolling works as expected.
fields.summary: Sidebar not scrollable in Safari

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When manually resizing the browser's windows, the text font in the cards will change once you drop the window. But after you perform an action like: drag and drop a card, right click -> move top top, etc., the font will go back to the default one.

I have reproduced it on the 1920x1080 and 1280x800 resolutions; Google Chrome.

See the recording: [^Window resizing.mp4]

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a board with 9 columns (I have reproduced it with 6 to 9 columns) and add some issues to a column;
 # Manually resize the browser's windows;
 # After the font changes, drag and drop one of the cards so the font will change again;
 # Perform a windows resize again, but now click with the right button on a card -> *Top of column*. The font will change again as well.

h3. Expected Results

There should be a fixed text font when resizing it.

h3. Actual Results

The text font will change. But performing an action right after the resizing will make it change back to it's previous size.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Manually resizing the browser's window will cause the card's text font size to change

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues are listed as scope change when they are added before the start of sprint

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sprint
# Create an issue
# Add the issue to sprint
# Click on 'Start Sprint'
#* The steps 3 and 4 four should happen on same minute. e.g: 12:00 PM
# Click on 'Start'
#* This should happen 1 minute after you click on 'Start Sprint'. e.g: 12:01 PM

h3. Expected Results
Issue should be listed as sprint scope one its started

h3. Actual Results
Issue is listed as scope change
 
h3. Notes
* The issue is not reproduced if you add the issue to the sprint then wait a minute to start it.

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Issues are listed as scope change when they are added before the start of sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There are few places in JIRA where the word 'Epic' seems to be hard coded, such as:
- In board page, click on more menu, you'll see the options *Show/Hide epics panel* and/or *Show/Hide epic labels*
 !Board menu.png|thumbnail! 
- In backlog > 'Epic' panel you could see *EPICS*, *Create epic*, *Create issue in epic* and *Issues without epics* options.
 !Backlog.png|thumbnail! 
- The system fields *Epic Name* and *Epic Link* in issues screens.
 !Issue View Screen (Bug).png|thumbnail!  !Issue View Screen (Epic).png|thumbnail! 

Currently even if we rename the issue type *Epic*, these options and labels persist having the word 'Epic'.

h3. Suggested Solution
When the issue type 'Epic' is renames, these labels should automatically match the new name.
fields.summary: When the issue type 'Epic' is renames, the labels and options related to 'Epics' should be matched with the new name.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New sprint's name is not generated according to the most recent sprint if there's any hidden sprint from different board.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project and board A
# Create project and board B
# On board A add a sprint named SA1
# On board B add a sprint named SB1
# Create a new sprint on board B and its name will be SB2
# On project A create a new issue and add to sprint SB2
#* SB2 will be shown on board A
# Close the issue created on board A 
#* The issue will disappear from board since resolved issues are not listed on backlog when the sprint is not active
#* SB2 will disappear from board A
# Create a new sprint on board A and its name will be SB3 instead of SA2

h3. Expected Results
Sprints follow the name pattern from the most recent sprint of the board

h3. Actual Results
Sprints follow the name pattern from sprints not listed on board
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: New sprint's name is not generated according to the most recent sprint

fields.description:
The gadget for the sprint health currently measures the sprint progress in story points. I would like to have a configuration option to be able to measure the progress in issue count as well.

 

Especially at the end of a sprint, we want to know how many stories are still open, especially to be reviewed. Reviewing an implementation of a story is less related to the story points than the actual implementation, as for instance design decisions do not need to be reconsidered. The effort for reviewing is more related to the pure number of issues to be reviewed.
fields.summary: Agile Sprint Health Gadget: allow to show health measured in "issue count"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's only the Assignee bundled quick filter.
If you have to filter by component, you'll have to create a series of quick filters.

h3. Suggested Solutions
It would be nice to have also a bundled quick filter to filter by Component.
fields.summary: Create a new quick filter for Components

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If there's a commit to an issue, the *Development Panel* in the issue view will show *1 commit*. However, once the project key is changed, and when a new commit with the new project key is being synced with JIRA, the commit still shows 1, instead of 2. 

Also, the *Development Panel* only show up if there's commit with the current project key. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a commit with *ABC-1* in the commit message
# Change the project key from *ABC* to *DEF*
# Perform a commit with *DEF-1* in the commit message
# Development Panel in *DEF-1* now shows 1 commit message only.

*OR*
# Perform a commit with *ABC-1* in the commit message
# Change the project key from *ABC* to *DEF*
# Perform a commit with *ABC-1* in the commit message
# Development Panel in *DEF-1* will not show any commit message
# Perform a commit again with *DEF-1* in the commit message
# Development Panel in *DEF-1* will only show 1 commit message. Clicking on it will show all 3 commits, including the commit with the old project key.

h3. Expected Results
* The Development Panel should count all commits, instead of the commits with the current project key only.

h3. Actual Results
* The Development Panel is only counting the commits with the current project key.
fields.summary: Commits count is not reflecting properly when Project Key is changed

fields.description: Some customers would like an integration for Jira with Verifix Greenline Financial Technologies.
fields.summary: Integration with Verifix Greenline Financial Technologies

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When viewing a Kanban Backlog that has issues from a Service Desk project, the "create linked issue" shortcut doesn't work. It keeps on the "Loading..." status inside the dropdown menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Kanban Backlog board which has Service Desk issues on it;
# Click on a Service Desk issue;
# Press the "gg" or "." (period) button to open the shortcut menu;
# Type in "create linked issue", then hit enter;

h3. Expected Results
* The creation issue screen is presented.

 !Create linked issues success.png|thumbnail! 

 !Create linked issues create screen.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The shortcut hangs on "Loading ...".

 !Create linked issues fail 1.png|thumbnail! 

 !Create linked issues fail 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* Access the issue through the "Full page view" and perform the "create linked issue" operation.
fields.summary: "Create linked issue" shortcut doesn't work for SD issues that are on a Kanban Backlog

fields.description: Hi, please closet his ticket, it was raised incorrectly.
fields.summary: Jira upgrade path

fields.description: Try finding an issue type scheme in a list of 100 without being able to sort or search.
fields.summary: Issue Type Schemes are not listed alphabetically or searchable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira throws error 404 when creating a Storie from an empty sprint if you previously moved the sprint to the top of the sprint lists.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum software project
# Add Stories to the backlog
# Create 3 sprints and add Stories to them
# Create a 4th sprint and move it to the top of the sprint list
# While at the top of the sprints and having no stories to that sprint, create a Storie from the sprint and hit enter.

h3. Expected Results
* Storie created

h3. Actual Results
* Jira redirects user to a 404 screen.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Waiting more than 15 seconds before creating the Story after moving the sprint to the top prevents the bug.
fields.summary: 404 error while creating stories from backlog sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this moment there is no straightforward way of creating a pull request in Bitbucket when a Jira issue is transitioned to a certain status.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a post-function that will do just that
h3. Workaround

The only known workaround is to install the ScriptRunner plugin and use it in a post function to send an API call to Bitbucket's endpoint. Bitbucket will then create a pull request based on that API call. However, this is not tested.
fields.summary: develop a post-function in Jira Software to create a pull request in BitBucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira Experience (new UI), ranking _Versions_ in a software project is done by hovering the mouse on a version, then dragging it in the desired position. The old UI was using a ☰ icon in the left side of each version for the drag and drop. This was more intuitive

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring back the ☰ icon on the left side of the _Versions_

h3. Workaround
Hover the mouse pointer over a version, notice the arrow changing in a hand symbol, then drag&drop the _Version_ in the desired position.
fields.summary: bring back the hamburger icon ☰ for ranking versions

fields.description: We want to turn off XML backups in our Jira application, please suggest a way how to do that.
fields.summary: Turn off XML backups

fields.description: Since sprints are not related to projects or boards, but to issues, I want a feature that lists the boards where a given sprint is being displayed.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want a list of all boards 'included in a sprint'

fields.description: Jira tasks is not generated through email but able to create by using panel on particular project .Required urgent help to fix this .
fields.summary: tasks not generated by email

fields.description:
Querying Jira when Sub-tasks are involved is not really possible,If I want to see all the issues in a particular epic with their sub-tasks, that or issues with a certain label with their subtasks (unless I apply that same label at the sub-task level).

I want to see all the issues in a particular epic with their sub-tasks without using any priced plug-ins. Please suggest me ways how to view that on Jira Enterprise.
fields.summary: want to see all the issues in a particular epic with their sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Column* Issue count does not match the Issues displayed on the Board when the *Swimlane* is based on *Epics* and the Project is sharing *Epics* with other Projects which isn't included in the Board filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Board with simple filter (project = A)
# Have Issues on that Board sharing Epics from another Project (project B)
# In the Board settings set the *Swimlane* to group by *Epics*

h3. Expected Results
The Issue count of the *Column* counts the total number of Issues displayed.

h3. Actual Results
It counts the total number of Issues with the status mapped to the *Column* which isn't necessarily displayed on the Board

 !KAN_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround for this
fields.summary: Column Issue count does not match Issues displayed

fields.description:
h2. Fixed
The issue is now fixed. If it is still happening on your board:
* Please do try changing something on the board (adding columns, moving a card to another column and back), and refreshing the board should revalidate the cache and fix the issue. 
* Clear browser local storage. On chrome: F12 (Developer tools) > Application > Clear Storage > Clear site data

----



h3. Summary
For software boards(Scrum and Kanban), when there's a date picker field configured to the card layout, the HTML codes are not being rendered and they are displaying as it is.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Date Picker* to the card layout for software boards
# The dates are displayed with HTML codes
{noformat} 
<span title=”12/july/18”><time datetime="2018/07/12">
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
* The dates should be displayed properly

h3. Actual Results
* The dates are displayed with HTML codes
fields.summary: Date picker field on Card layout for software board is not rendering HTML properly

fields.description: Since yesterday when I move a task to DONE column (at a SCRAM board) it just disappeared...
fields.summary: Resolved issues disappeared from SCRAM board

fields.description:
Please check [this video|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CFsn455yyr9nuS9Xj9phbjh607Rmj1UD/view]

Every time a user creates a board through his profile page, when the user selects the project to be displayed on the board, the board's location is switched to the project, instead of keeping the user profile.

It would be a better user experience to keep the board's location field to the user profile, once the user is creating the board directly through his profile page.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want Jira to keep my profile as location when I create a new board through my profile page

fields.description: Quick filters on Boards are now currently grouped in a drop-down menu, some users find the old button style for quick filters easier to use. So we would like to see the option to toggle between drop-down menu or button style for quick filters on boards.
fields.summary: Quick filters on Boards should have the option to have button style (as the old design)

fields.description: When I first signed in into Jira I've been asked to update profile pic. I did that. But after while picture disappeared everywhere. So I updated picture again and same thing happened. Happing for other users as well.
fields.summary: Profile picture disappear after while

fields.description: Jira Software uses the /rest/inline-create/ API endpoint to create issues - it would be great if this could be made public as it takes into account a filter on the agile board which includes labels/components and sets those fields on the issue when creating it.
fields.summary: Please make the inline-create REST endpoint public

fields.description: When moving a card in an Active Sprint from "In Review" to "Done" in the new Jira the system defaults to having the "Withdrawn" section at the top and the "Close" section at the bottom of the column. Seems that it would be more intuitive to have the "Withdrawn column at the bottom which would require extra navigation effort to Withdraw a card vs. the left to right movement to Close a card.
fields.summary: Active Sprints / Done Column / Change order of "Withdrawn" and "Close" subsections

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If you are in the backlog view of a scrum board and on *Create issue*, it will be displayed the issue type options (according to what the board displays). But if after that, you change the board (swap to another board), the available issue types will be the same as from the previous board.
 Reloading the page gets it back to normal.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a scrum board's backlog and click on the *Create issue* option so the issue types will be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 2.19.06 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 2.19.14 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Now, swap to another board:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 2.20.19 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # You will see that the issue types displayed as options are the same as in the previous board (but in this board, my filter is set to display only the Task issue type: *project = FP AND issuetype in (Task) ORDER BY Rank ASC*):
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 2.20.42 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Reload the page and see that the options are now displayed correctly:
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-20 at 2.29.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The issue types should correspond to the new selected board.
h3. Actual Results

The issue types displayed inherit from the previous board.
h3. Workaround

Reloading the page will update the issue types to be displayed.
fields.summary: The available issue types for issue creation in the backlog view won't load correctly when swapping boards until you reload the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a sub-task for an issue in Epic Issue view, the sub-task created will be the child of Epic instead of the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an epic, *Epic A*
# Link *Issue A* to *Epic A*
# From *Epic A* issue view, click on the action button(cog icon) for *Issue A*
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Click *Create sub-task*
# Once the sub-task is created, the sub-task is not created under *Issue A*, instead, it is directly under *Epic A*.

h3. Expected Results
* The sub-task should be created under *Issue A*

h3. Actual Results
* The sub-task is created under *Epic A*
fields.summary: Sub-tasks can be created under Epic

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to report or see the aggregate workload for a given assignee per sprint is to view the "workload by assignee" modal in a sprint. This does not facilitate reporting and cannot be focused on individual users.

Would it be possible to get a gadget that can aggregate the workload of assignees per sprint, or aggregate workloads by a JQL string or filter?

This would help to facilitate reporting and dashboards and assist in proper assignments and commitments.
fields.summary: Add ability to see aggregate workload of a specific assignee per Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The color picker in the preview issue screen does not open

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Software project, Backlog view and click any issue in the backlog
# In the _Preview Issue_ section on the right, attempt to edit the issue and open the color picker

h3. Expected Results
The color picker opens and different text colors can be selected

h3. Actual Results
The color picker does not open

h3.Workaround
In order to write text in different colors, one needs to open the issue in the main _View issue_ screen and edit it there, as the color picker works in that screen
fields.summary: color picker does not open

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently if a Jira cloud site has one or more projects of type Agility, the option in backup manager to generate *Backup for server* is not available. Either a message should say that clearly or option should be made available again.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create at least one new project of Agility type.
# Go to backup manager
# Only *Backup for cloud* option will be available

h3. Expected Result
* Either both options should be available i.e. *Backup for Server* and *Backup for Cloud* OR
* There should be a clear message saying why *Backup for Server* option is not available

h3. Actual Result
Only *Backup for cloud* option will be available without any clear message.

h3. Workaround
Migrate Agility projects data to regular / standard type projects by
* Creating new standard type projects
* Move issues across (can use bulk move)
* Delete Agility type projects
* *Backup for Server* option will appear again.
fields.summary: Enable "backup for server option" for sites with Agility projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pull requests information is inaccurate on Development Panel. On some cases the amount of PRs is wrong and for other the status is incorrect.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud integrated with Bitbucket Cloud or GitHub

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue that has related pull requests

h3. Expected Results
The development panel shows the amount of PRs and the status

h3. Actual Results
The development panel shows the wrong amount of PRs and when the user clicks on it more items are listed.

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround

Please contact Atlassian support
fields.summary: Pull requests information is inaccurate on Development Panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As part of Backbone Sync App configuration, the epic ID is linked via edit issue screen's issue link field. This results in the epic link custom field to be populated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an issue (click Edit button)
# Add the epic ID in the Issue Link field
# Save
# Do a Get Issue REST call to the edited issue

h3. Expected Results
The epic link custom field should not be populated.

h3. Actual Results
The epic link custom field got the value placed on the Issue Link field.

h3.Workaround
Instead of using the edit issue screen to add the issue link, use *"..." > Link*
fields.summary: Adding an Epic ID via Edit Screen's Issue Link field results in epic link custom field population

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While attempting to print an Agile card, much of the text is not included in the printed card

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a Description field that contains at least 5-6 words
# Include that issue in a card on an Agile Board.
# Print the card

h3. Expected Results
All the text inside the card should appear on the print
 !story.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Most of the text is cut and does not appear on the printed card
 !story print.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3.Workaround
One workaround is using the [Agile Cards Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.spartez.scrumprint.scrumplugin/cloud/overview] for Jira which allows for some more customization when printing a card
fields.summary: text in Agile cards does not fit in the printed card

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Burndown report is not consistent for issues on unmapped statuses. Some issues moved to the unmapped status will be listed as completed while others will be listed as reopened.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum project
# Set an status as unmapped on the board
# Create a sprint and add two issues on it
# Move both issues to the status mapped to the first column and start the sprint.
# Move issue 1 to the unmapped status
# Move issue 2 to the last column
# Move issue 2 to the unmapped status

h3. Expected Results
Both issues' last entry on report should be the same on report.

h3. Actual Results
The last entry for issue 1 will be "Issue completed" while the last entry for issue 2 will be "Issue reopened"
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Burndown report is not consistent for issues on unmapped statuses

fields.description:
Currently it's only possible to add/edit the column's name in the board. As per requested by the customer, it would be very useful to provide admins ability to add custom fields or description to columns in board.

This could help admins to share the notifications and announcements in regards to each column with the team.
fields.summary: Ability to add custom fields or descriptions to board's column

fields.description:
I am cloning Jira project and ended with error as :
h1. Sorry, we had some technical problems during your last operation.
h2. Cause

Referer URL: *url*

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/jira/web/action/project/AddProject
fields.summary: Cannot clone project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The error or warning message in Development Tools setting page is not informative enough. At the moment, if you are using unsupported port (such as 8080, for example), it simply says that it's "Unsupported". For a lot of people, we might think that the version of our server app and tries to upgrade it, while that's not the right problem.

h3. Suggested Solution
We should extend the way of giving exceptions to the frontend jira application so it would be more clear, especially in "Development Tools" setting page. Be clearer on what is actually the problem, so that customers don't have to contact support to know the problem.

h3. Why this is important
Clearer error or warning message will allow customers to troubleshoot their own issue better, without the need to raise a support ticket
fields.summary: Improve the error or warning message in Development Tools setting page

fields.description: When in User Management, you can't get back to the project or to Jira home... site is really hard to maneuver through...
fields.summary: Navigation from User Management

fields.description: When I click on a user on page 2 and go back to edit another it keeps defaulting to the first page - please go back to the original page I was on - since the page numbering is at the bottom of the page as well, it goes back to page 1, have to scroll down to get to the page and continue from where I was...
fields.summary: User Management Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding sprints in backlog impacts the location of popup window which appears when right-click on an issues in backlog. Adding more sprints furthers the popup screen from the mouse cursor.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a software project (with Scrum board)
# Create several sprints (e.g 10 sprints)
# Right click on an issue in the backlog

h3. Expected Results
The popup screen should be appeared beside the cursor.

h3. Actual Results
The popup screen appears with noticable distance from the cursor.

h3. Notes
* Adding more sprints to the board furthers the popup screen from cursor.
* Deleted/completed sprints do not have any impact on this issue.

h3.Workaround
Remove the unnecessary sprints and reduce the amount of sprints (e.g 5 sprints).
fields.summary: Amount of sprints impacts the location of popup window which appears when right-click on issues in backlog

fields.description: The plugin manager currently does not provide a confirmation box when selecting to update an installed plugin in the Manage Add Ons screen. It is very easy to accidentally press the button whilst reviewing plugins and plugins can quite often contain breaking changes as such this makes it quite easy to cause issues on a production instance of JIRA.
fields.summary: Plugin Update - Confirmation

fields.description:
As per requested by the customer, it would be interesting to allow managers/users to see who deleted a Sprint so that they can keep all actions on track. This info should be displayed in audit logs to make it simple to the users to find it.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow users/managers to see who deleted Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add Epics to a version, the Version report considers Epics as unestimated items, but it is not possible to set estimation to Epics

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a SCRUM project creates one epic and some stories
# In the same project, create one version and one sprint
# Set estimation to the stories
# Add  the stories to the version and to the sprint
# Start the sprint, complete the issues and complete the sprint
# Release the version
# Check the Version report

h3. Expected Results
The report considers only the estimated and unestimated stories

h3. Actual Results
The report considers only all the stories and the epic also

 !Screen Shot 2018-04-11 at 9.26.10 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes


h3.Workaround

No workarounds for now
fields.summary: Version report includes Epics (unestimatable issues) in the % Unestimated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing issues in the backlog, cards are placed in the left, just under the issue's key. Estimation is placed in the far right position.

h3. Suggested Solution
Would be interesting if we had the ability to exchange the position of both fields.

 !Feature Request.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
Further enhance the already awesome board customizations.

h3. Workaround 
For this request in particular, there is none.
fields.summary: Agility to exchange cards and estimation positions

fields.description: For the last few meetings we have referred to the comment section and it doesn't have the time when the comment was made and is important for us due to the delay from the client in their responses. Please add the time and not just "Yesterday"...
fields.summary: Comments - Add Time

fields.description: Whenever I go to an issue list, the default is by Priority - I always have to change it to KEY since I want to always see the most recent - is there anyway of setting the default so it's always by Key?
fields.summary: Default on sort on issues

fields.description:
Each time I'm in a project and go to Issues, I should be able to see all my filters I created for that project but since it's not there, have to go back to Jira home to go to manage issues to find all my saved filters - makes no sense... can you please put all my project filters in my actual project so when I select Issues, I see all my relevant filters instead of having to go through everything to find my filters.

Unless I'm missing something but this is really frustrating....
fields.summary: Viewing Saved Filters in Issues

This happens when I try to see current sprint.

fields.summary: French version bug

fields.description:
When I'm already in a project and want to go back to my dashboard, I have to go back to Jira Home and to Dashboard and select the project - need a quick link to be able to access the dashboard for the specific project when I'm already in the project.

Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to get to Dashboard Easily

fields.description:
Time and time I go to create new filters to filter out everything that's not closed and I have to click each and every one to get what I want - same as Issue Type. Want to be able to select everything except one or 2 and have to go and select one at a time.... Can you please have an option to select all so I can unselect one or two I don't want in the filter.. Surprised it's not there already.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Filtering Issues Ability to Select All

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user does not have access to a project based on the board's filter, and card colors are set based on 'Queries', the user won't be able to see the card colors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create software projects 'AAA' and 'BBB' using different permission scheme
# Grant user ABC with access to project 'AAA', and make sure the user is not granted with access to project 'BBB'
# In project 'AAA', set the filter for Kanban board as 'project in (AAA, BBB)'
# In project 'AAA', set the Card colors based on 'Queries', and add some colors
#* Add some colors
#* For JQL, you may user any JQL, e.g 'project=AAA AND component=test'
# Browse the Kanban board for project 'AAA'

h3. Expected Results
Card colors appears based on the JQL set

h3. Actual Results
Card colors do not appear for the user that is not granted access to all projects as per board's filter

h3. Workaround
* Grant the user permission to all projects as per board's filter
* Update the board's filter and exclude those projects to which user is not granted access
* Set card colors based on different parameters. e.g Issue types, Priorities, etc.

h3. Notes
Generally, if the <Board_Filter> AND <Card_Filter> JQL query returns an error for the user, the card color will not load.
fields.summary: Card Colors doesn't work if the colors are based on 'Queries' and user is not granted access to all projects based on board's filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, columns configuration are set per Board. For example we’re creating sprints for each release, and some columns are not used for those sprints. For other sprints they ARE used. So it would be helpful if its possible to be able to predefine the columns per sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow columns to be configured on sprint level
 
h3. Workaround 
Run different boards with different column configurations for the project; eg:
* Board A with column configuration A
* Board B with column configuration B

Since the sprints can appear in both boards as long as they share the same filter, you can decide in which board would you like to create and start your sprint, so that you can use that board's column configuration
fields.summary: Allow users to define sprint-level columns configuration

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently the 'Configure fields' configuration on the create/edit issue screen is a global configuration (on the user end). If a user hides field A on project 1, field A will be hidden as well on project 2. 

Changing the feature to be project specific will eliminate problems where user gets 'required field' error but they forgot that they have actually hidden the field. Since the 'Configure fields' button is not exactly very visible, it's pretty common for users to forget that it exist or they have actually hidden some fields.
fields.summary: Change the 'Configure fields' configuration on the create/edit issue screen to be project specific

fields.description:
Summary
 - Scrollbar is missing from Agile Reports which makes it difficult to navigate

 

Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any agile reports from software board

h3. Expected Results
 - Visibility of the scrollbar to scroll

h3. Actual Results
 - Scrollbar on the right is missing from the UI
 - !image-2018-04-06-23-51-57-412.png|width=715,height=392!

h3. Workaround
 - Still able to scroll using optical mouse scroll
fields.summary: Missing scrollbar from all agile reports

fields.description:
*Summary*
The option to add checkboxes to list items (similar to bulletpoints) that users can check off upon the completion of a task. This is an available option in Confluence when editing a document. Checklists can also lessen the need to create more issues for individual tasks as it would be possible to have "micro" tasks within an issue.

*Environment*

Jira

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # create list items in issue description
 # highlight list items
 # click "tasklist" in the formatting menu
 # check off completed tasks

*Expected Results*
A checklist in an issue that enables improved task management.

*Actual Results*
A checklist of tasks within the description of an issue.

*Workaround*
Bullet list - add a strikethrough when a task is completed
fields.summary: Checklists in issue descriptions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Workflow triggers based on Bamboo Deployment status do not function.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud with Application Link to Bamboo Server and DVCS connection to repository
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Build Plan and a linked Deployment Project in Bamboo
 # Associate a JIRA Issue with the Build Plan via commit in the repository the plan is configured to pull from.
 # Edit the JIRA Workflow that the issue is currently using
 # Add a "Deployment successful" Trigger to a transition specifying the deployment project and environment created previously
 # Run the Build Plan and linked Deployment Project

h3. Expected Results

Deployment project completes successfully. Associated workflow trigger is fired and the JIRA issue associated with the build plan is transitioned.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. The issue is not transitioned. 
  
h3. Notes

Neither JIRA Cloud or Bamboo log any errors or failures. The "Deployment failed" trigger also doesn't function if you force the deployment project to fail in some way.
h3. Workaround

None at this time.
fields.summary: Bamboo Deployment Workflow Triggers Do Not Function

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Board is not loading - Not correctly rendering
* Error 500 in the console

h3. Environment
* Jira Software boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the board backlog or active sprints view

h3. Expected Results
* The board should load correctly

h3. Actual Results
* The board won't load and will not render correctly
 !rendering-error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The following errors may appear in the console

{code}
GET https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json?rapidViewId=1&selectedProjectKey=ABC&_=1522954471500 500 ()
{code}

{code}
{errorMessages: ["This board has no columns with a mapped status."], errors: {}}
errorMessages
:
["This board has no columns with a mapped status."]
errors
:
{}
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Go to Board settings > Columns and recreate the columns.
fields.summary: Boards not loading and not rendering correctly - Error 500

fields.description:
*Summary*
Sub-tasks created inside a custom standard issue type appear as 'issues without epic' when using swimlanes based on epics on a board

*Environment*

*Steps to Reproduce*
# create an epic and assign it to user1
# create a custom standard issue type inside the epic and assign it to user1
# create a sub-task inside the custom standard issue type and assign it to user2
# go to the project board and change its settings to show the issues using swimlanes based on epic
# go to the board and use the filter 'Assignee' and select the assignee of the sub-task (user2)

*Expected Results*
The sub-task will appear under the respective epic

*Actual Results*
The sub-task will appear at the end of the board as 'issues without epic'

*Workaround*
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Sub-tasks created inside a custom standard issue type appear as 'issues without epic' when using swimlanes based on epics on a board

fields.description: When I add the Sprint field to the My Open Issues search filter, the active sprint doesn't always appear in the short list of sprints, instead it has to be manually searched for using the text input. This is really annoying.
fields.summary: Active sprint not shown in Sprint drop-down

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no feature available to transition issues automatically to any status after a certain period of time.
h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to automate the issues transition so that an issue is automatically transitioned to any status if this issue is not updated for a period of time.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Automate issues transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User is not able to scroll down to the bottom of the screen.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Access Jira
2. Access a project
3. Access the board
4. Click on an issue
5. Try to scroll down to the bottom of the screen

h3. Expected Results

User must be able to scroll down the screen until it reaches its bottom.

h3. Actual Results

User is not able to scroll the screen all the way down, it gets stuck in a point and comments or attachments section are not completely shown on screen.

h3. Notes

N/A

h3.Workaround
Access issue screen and add comments/attachments there.
fields.summary: User is not able to scroll down to the bottom of the screen.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you remove issues from your release X, then access your release X page, click any issue and goes back, the issues count will display a wrong value.

See this for more details
*  [^720p.mov] 
* https://cl.ly/442v40363n1k

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud (Jira 29bdfe7c)
* Jira Software Releases page
* Chrome Version 65.0.3325.181 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a release X
# create a test sprint
# go to the backlog view and create 10 issues
# add these issues to the sprint and to the release X
# start the sprint
# move some issues to the in progress column
# remove 1 issue from the release X
# go to the release X page and notice the issues count (issues in version, issues in progress, issues to do)
# click to filter issues in progress or issues to do
# click any issue
# click the _back_ button of your browser to go to the previous page
# notice the issues count now

h3. Expected Results
Release page should show the correct number of issues

h3. Actual Results
Release will show a different number of issues.

h3. Notes
* Not reproducible in Safari and Edge

h3. Workaround
* Make sure to refresh (F5) the page to know the updated and correct value
* View in issue navigator (fixVersion = xxxx)
* Use another browser such as Edge or Safari
fields.summary: In Chrome, removing issues from Release will cause wrong issues count in the release page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever you view swimlanes on the new UI boards, the expand button does not appear or work

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a board with swimlanes (Example: stories)
 # Go to board swimlanes
 # No expand button appears

h3. Expected Result
An expand button appears for the swimlanes
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-29 at 16.11.58.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
No expand button appears

h3. Workaround
currently none
fields.summary: Board Swim-lane expand button not working on new UI
Epics on a Kanban board with backlog affected by Quick Filter

fields.description: If I am working in a project to change the fields on the screen, the navigation keeps taking me to the system administration side with no easy way to get back. It's very very frustrating.
fields.summary: Administrator Navigation is Terrible
Epic Link is displaying Epics from other projects

fields.description:
I have been a Jira user for 5 years and have been mostly happy with the software but today I have decided to do what I have never done in 5 years - to write down how stupid the security and permissions management is in JIRA. Frankly, I am appalled at how complicated and unintuitive it is.

Within every project there is People section. What good is it if adding people there does not give them access to this project?

After many hours of adjusting permission schemes, I managed to set it up so that an issue can be assigned to a user... who cannot see the issue! Why ohh why do you let issues to be assigned to users who cannot see them?!

And I do not want to get into Permission Scheme management. it is simply not worth my time. Toi add a user to Jira and give them access to one project is simply mission impossible and requires a certification in Jira management and likely 6 months of training.
fields.summary: Jira Permissions Management - Ridiculously Complex
Turn off auto complete on search assign

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to select the Sprint or Estimation field in the drop-down list in the Burnup Chart, it is very difficult to select any values, as the drop-down list keeps disappearing due to a small gap between the textbox and the drop-down list. When the cursor hovers on the gap, the list disappears.
h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Scrum board with at least 2 Sprints created.
 # Go to Reports -> Burnup Chart
 # Attempt to change the Sprint by clicking on the Sprint name. Similarly, attempt to do the same with the Estimation Field.
 # Select the desired Sprint or Estimation field.

h3. Expected Results

The user is able to hover the cursor over to the desired value, and select it.
h3. Actual Results

The drop-down list disappears, and the user is unable to select the value. Please refer to the attached GIF.
 !select-sprint.gif|width=747,height=434!
h3. Notes
 # Using Google Chrome, Version 65.0.3325.181 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 # This might also affect other reports.

h3. Workaround

Once you've clicked on the textbox, use the arrow keys to select the desired value, and press "Enter".
fields.summary: Very difficult to select the Sprint or Estimation field in Jira's Burnup Chart

fields.description:
Hello , 

Currently we are using Jira 6.1 and looking to upgrade Jira to it's latest i.e. 7.8 but have concern about Jira Agile Plugin.

So, after completion of import to new Jira. It will  show me all the agile board which are present with present version or don't as the new Jira version don't support this plugin.
fields.summary: Regarding JIRA Upgarade and Kanban Board

fields.description: I used jqlquerybuilder api to build my queries dynamically when gets the input from the UI. But it is showing some Component Accessor Exception always.. Is there any way to build a query dynamically in jira?...........If there ....please provide me a suggestion.
fields.summary: JQL Query Builder is not working for me.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The page loads incompletely when the columns are removed from the Software Board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a default Software Project
 !WT_board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the Board > Click on *...* icon > Board Settings > Remove all the columns

h3. Expected Results
The image and the text in the Board space must be loaded completely

h3. Actual Results
The Board appears as given in the screenshot
  !Bug_WT_board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround. The Board appears proper only with the columns configured in it
fields.summary: The content does not load completely when the columns are removed from the boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The custom field type select list (cascade) child, does not update properly when shown the in the cards on boards. The child is the second drop-down list from the screenshot below. 
!Screen Shot 2018-03-28 at 1.29.51 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create and configure a custom filed of the Select List (cascade) type
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-28 at 1.35.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Associate the custom field with a screen
 # Create an issue and set the value for the custom field Select List (cascade).
 # On the board configure the custom field to show
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-28 at 1.34.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Once done with the above, try changing the value of the created custom field
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-28 at 1.38.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result
The value on the board should change to reflect the new change.

h3. Actual results
Nothing happens. On the board, the selected value is always the value of the first element in the select list (cascade) child.
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-28 at 1.38.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
currently none
fields.summary: Custom field type Cascade selector child not working properly on boards
